entry.title: Erika Bare announced as new South Umpqua superintendent
entry.summary: SOUTH UMPQUA — After a lengthy search, the South Umpqua School District board announced that Erika Bare has been appointed as the next superintendent.

entry.title: Roseburg students qualify for state in FBLA regionals competition
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Coffenberry Middle School was a scene of students and advisors dressed in business clothes, as students from across Douglas and Josephine counties gathered to show their business skills.

entry.title: Roseburg Public Library celebrates love
entry.summary: Valentine’s Day provides the perfect opportunity to read books about love. As a bonus, all of our picks this month are written by literary icons — writers who get a lot of love from readers whenever they publish a new…

author.name: AURORA ROPP AND KRIS WILEY For The News-Review

entry.title: Research resources available at the library
entry.summary: Researchers interested in local newspaper archives may want to stop by Roseburg Public Library.

author.name: Kris Wiley for The News Review

entry.title: Bar Run Golf and RV Resort gets summer ready with new pool
entry.summary: Guests will now get the opportunity to sink or swim at the Bar Run Golf and RV Resort in Roseburg. After sinking those golf balls on the 18-hole, par-70 course designed by Dan Hixson, visitors can relax by the 12,000…

entry.title: Local college student buried under parking tickets
entry.summary: For nearly a year, Umpqua Community College student athlete Andrew Lacey has been buried under parking tickets.

entry.title: Windy Cove Crab and Fishing dock closed
entry.summary: WINCHESTER BAY —Windy Cove Crab and Fishing Dock will be temporarily closing to asses water damage incurred in early January.

entry.title: Eastwood students catch fish, ride in jet boat with guides
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Students from Roseburg's Eastwood Elementary School sat in drift boats with yellow lifejackets. Orange and green bobbers sat in the water as the kids waited for a fish to bite.

entry.title: UVA to host youth art workshop Saturday
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Umpqua Valley Arts will hold a youth workshop 10 a.m. to noon Saturday.

entry.title: Celebrate literacy throughout February
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — The Celebration of Literacy is underway for the month of February.

entry.title: Inspired Healthcare Capital breaks ground on memory care facility in Green
entry.summary: GREEN — Inspired Healthcare Capital, a private equity firm based out of Arizona, has broken ground on a new $20.8 million memory care and assisted living facility on 100 Winery Lane in Green.

entry.title: Learn 'How Not to Age' at UCC on Tuesday
entry.summary: Physician, renowned international speaker and author of the New York Times best-selling book, “How Not to Die,” Dr. Michael Greger will be presenting topics covered in his latest book, “How Not to Age,” on Tuesday at Umpqua Community College’s Jacoby…

entry.title: Rope tricks and cultural dances at Roseburg library
entry.summary: A white rope fluttered around the man holding it, shaping into loops around him which he stepped in and out of, as people filed into the room and sat in the metal chairs to watch.

entry.title: Greatest of the Grape this Saturday
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — The 52nd annual Greatest of the Grape event will take place from 6-11 p.m. Saturday at Seven Feathers Casino Resort in Canyonville.

entry.title: Elkton School District searches for new principal
entry.summary: ELKTON — Douglas Education Service District noted Elkton School District is on the search for a new principal, and qualified applicants are welcome to apply.

entry.title: Another year of geocaching in Roseburg returns
entry.summary: Roseburg Parks and Recreation is inviting modern day treasure hunters of all ages to the Discover Roseburg 13 Land of Umpqua Geocache Series kick-off Saturday.

entry.title: Man shoots woman with BB gun, claims self defense
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Sutherlin Police Department arrested Reyes Leon Mendoza on Sunday evening following an alleged altercation in which he reportedly shot a woman with a BB gun pistol.

entry.title: ROSEBURG WORKING TO SIMPLIFY PARKING TICKET APPEALS PROCESS
entry.summary: February 1, 2024 4:50 a.m. Information from the City of Roseburg said that staff is working with parking program contractor ACE Parking to simplify the parking ticket appeals process. entry.title: ROSEBURG SEES WARMEST TWO DAYS EVER THE MONTH OF JANUARY
entry.summary: February 1, 2024 4:20 a.m. Roseburg had the warmest two days ever for the month of January, on Tuesday and Wednesday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 69 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport on both days. Forecasters said that Chinook...

entry.title: CELEBRATION OF LITERACY UNDERWAY THROUGH FEBRUARY
entry.summary: February 1, 2024 3:45 a.m. The Celebration of Literacy is underway for the month of February. Sponsored by Altrusa of Roseburg and the Umpqua Literacy Council, the annual series of events began twenty-three years ago. Celebration of Literacy could also be described as an immersion into reading and reading related activities. Since the pandemic, the...

entry.title: ROSEBURG LIBRARY TO HOST CHARRERIA PROGRAM
entry.summary: February 1, 2024 3:30 a.m. Roseburg Public Library will host a Mexican cultural program on Thursday night at 6:30 p.m. Communidad y Herencia Cultural Director Antonio Huerta will speak about the history and tradition of Charreria, the 500-year old practice of horsemanship and roping that was adopted as Mexico’s official national sport in 1933. Huerta...

entry.title: Veteran Marge Cook dies at 104
entry.summary: Marjorie "Marge" Cook was one of the first women to enlist in the military — the first in Allegan County, Michigan, when she was 24. She died Jan. 26, at age 104.

entry.title: UACT, underwater exploration in "20,000 Leagues Under the Seas"
entry.summary: Professor Arronax and a team of explorers set out to investigate a terrifying sea creature, and find themselves kidnapped by Captain Nemo, as Umpqua Actors Community Theatre takes a deep-sea dive in “20,000 Leagues Under the Seas,” starting Thursday night.

entry.title: SUTHERLIN POLICE CHARGE MAN WITH UNAUTHORIZED USE OF A VEHICLE
entry.summary: January 31, 2024 10:10 a.m. Sutherlin Police charged a man with unauthorized use of a motor vehicle on Tuesday. An SPD report at 5:30 p.m. an officer located a stolen vehicle at the intersection of West Central Avenue and Ponderosa Drive. The SUV traveled northbound on Interstate 5 and a second officer responded to assist....

entry.title: FUGITIVE DETAINED BY ROSEBURG POLICE EARLY WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: January 31, 2024 9:50 a.m. A fugitive was detained by Roseburg Police early Wednesday. An RPD report said at 3:10 a.m. the 23-year old was contacted in the 900 block of Northeast Rowe Street. He was found to have a Wyoming warrant for absconding. The man was taken into custody and detained without bail.

entry.summary: January 31, 2024 9:40 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for four warrants Tuesday afternoon. An RPD report said just after 12:40 p.m. officers contacted 33-year old David Mundy in the 800 block of Northeast Alameda Avenue, knowing he was wanted. Warrants were confirmed through records and he was taken into custody. Mundy was charged...

entry.title: Fatal car crash in Green
entry.summary: A multi-vehicle accident in the Green district had fatal results Tuesday afternoon.

entry.title: Recalls for Gardiner Sanitary Board unsuccessful
entry.summary: GARDINER — Preliminary election results show that recalls for two positions on the Gardiner Sanitary Board were unsuccessful.

entry.title: Riddle celebrates its 131st birthday with horses, stews and memorabilia
entry.summary: RIDDLE — Doc and Duke planted their furry, black hooves on Second Avenue and Main Street, dragging a red, wooden wagon, ready to take residents for a ride in celebration of Riddle’s 131st birthday on Tuesday.

entry.title: Roseburg Christian Academy hosts theater comedy this weekend
entry.summary: The sounds of animal noises and biblical references rang out from the stage as students practiced for the last time in their dress rehearsal Tuesday night.

entry.title: Trace Amines: A new treatment pathway in psychiatry
entry.summary: Cells in the brain, called neurons, communicate with one another using chemicals known as neurotransmitters. Many neurotransmitters are derived from amino acids, the building blocks of protein.
